title: Sinner to Face Alcaraz in US Open Final, Trump to Attend

Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner will meet for the third Grand Slam final in a row when they play for the US Open title.

US President Donald Trump plans to watch the men's final of the US Open tennis tournament in person in New York on Sunday, organizers have confirmed. This marks the third consecutive Grand Slam final between Sinner and Alcaraz. The winner will decide the world No. 1 ranking. US President Donald Trump plans to attend the final in New York.

title: Chargers Beat Chiefs 27-21 in NFL Opener in Brazil, Ending Losing Streak
snippets: Chargers hold on for win at Corinthians Arena in S√£o Paulo in the potentially critical AFC West battle.
Justin Herbert stars for the Los Angeles Chargers as they beat the Kansas City Chiefs 27-21 in their NFL opener in Sao Paulo, Brazil.
Justin Herbert finished off the Los Angeles Chargers' season-opening victory in style, sliding for a first down that effectively ended the game.

Justin Herbert threw for 318 yards and three touchdowns in outdueling Patrick Mahomes, and the Los Angeles Chargers beat Kansas City 27-21 on Friday night in Sao Paulo, snapping a seven-game skid to the Chiefs.
titles: Herbert shines as Chargers earn AFC West win over Chiefs in Brazil

summary: The Los Angeles Chargers defeated the Kansas City Chiefs 27-21 in their NFL season opener in S√£o Paulo, Brazil. Justin Herbert led the Chargers with 318 passing yards and three touchdowns, outperforming Patrick Mahomes. This victory ended the Chargers' seven-game losing streak against the Chiefs and took place at the Corinthians Arena. Herbert's late-game slide for a first down sealed the win for the Chargers.

title: Tesla Unveils $1T Potential Compensation Plan for Musk, Targets $8.5T Valuation
snippets: Tesla's board said the controversial CEO has threatened to leave the company more than once. The staggering pay package is designed to make him stay.
Elon Musk is already the wealthiest person in the world.
Elon Musk's $1 trillion Tesla pay package requires finding a successor, which could be a tall order for a brand so tied to its CEO.
Tesla Chair Robyn Denholm said the proposed pay package for Elon Musk is meant to keep his "focus and attention" on the EV maker.

Tesla has proposed a new 10-year compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk that could be worth as much as $1 trillion even as the EV maker's car business stumbles and it sets its sights on humanoid robotics and AI.
titles: Tesla board proposes $1 trillion pay package for Elon Musk
Tesla's proposed pay package could make Elon Musk a trillionaire
Elon Musk could get a $1 trillion pay package — but he has to find his successor first
Tesla's $1 trillion pay package for Elon Musk boils down to one thing: Keeping the attention of the world's richest man
Tesla proposes new pay package for Elon Musk worth up to $1T
summary: Tesla has introduced a new 10-year compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk, potentially worth up to $1 trillion. This plan requires Musk to increase Tesla's value from just over $1tn to $8.5tn. The proposal is notable for its ambitious growth target and the significant potential payout, amidst Tesla's focus on expanding into humanoid robotics and AI, despite challenges in its electric vehicle business.

summary: Sixteen people, including three Brits, two Canadians, five Portuguese, two South Koreans, one American, one French, one Swiss, and one Ukrainian, were killed in a funicular derailment in Lisbon. Recovery efforts have highlighted damage to a cable connecting the funicular's cars.

title: Sabalenka to Face Anisimova in US Open Final
snippets: No. 1 Sabalenka will take on No. 8 Anisimova in the US Open final Saturday. Who will prevail? It's not as straightforward as it seems on paper.

Aryna Sabalenka will be seeking her fourth Grand Slam title overall and second straight at the U.S. Open when she faces Amanda Anisimova in the women's final at Arthur Ashe Stadium on Saturday.  The No. 1-seeded Sabalenka is a 27-year-old from Belarus who will be playing in her third major title mat

summary: Aryna Sabalenka, the defending champion and world No. 1, is set to compete against No. 8 seed Amanda Anisimova in the US Open women's final on Saturday. Both players have faced challenges in Grand Slam tournaments this season, adding a layer of anticipation to the match. The event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports starting at 9pm.

title: Trump Signs Order for "Department of War" as Secondary Title
snippets: Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth says the name change signals a more offensive approach for the US military under Trump.
US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to change the name of the Department of Defense to the "Department of War." This move revives a name that was abandoned over seven decades ago.
President Trump signed an executive order renaming the Department of Defense the Department of War, though a formal name change would require Congress to act.

Directive will make Department of War secondary title and is way to get around need for congressional approval

Donald Trump signed an executive order on Friday to rebrand the Department of Defense as the Department of War, a call
titles: Trump changes the Department of Defense‚Äôs name to ‚ÄòDepartment of War‚Äô

summary: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to rename the Department of Defense as the "Department of War," a title last used over 70 years ago. While the change signals a more offensive military posture, a formal name change requires Congressional approval. The executive order makes "Department of War" a secondary title to circumvent the need for Congress's approval.

Rayner's resignation is seen as a significant setback for Starmer, who had previously supported her.

summary: A federal judge blocked the Trump administration's attempt to end temporary legal protections for over 1 million Haitian and Venezuelan immigrants in the U.S. This decision preserves the temporary protected status granted by the Biden administration, ensuring these individuals maintain their legal status in the country.

title: Rare "Blood Moon" Eclipse Visible in UK Sunday Evening
snippets: A total lunar eclipse makes the moon shine with all the sunrises and sunsets on Earth ‚Äî at the same time. But how? The moon is in Earth's shadow! Here's what‚Äôs going on.

The satellite will turn deep red as the Earth passes between the sun and the moon at about 7.30pm on Sunday

A rare total lunar eclipse ‚Äúblood moon‚Äù will be visible from the UK on Sunday night for the first time since 2022.

The moon is expected to turn a deep, dark red as the Earth pas
The year's second total lunar eclipse is coming up fast, and this time Asia will have the best seats in the cosmos.
titles: Blood Moon this Sunday: What makes a total lunar eclipse

summary: A rare total lunar eclipse, known as a "blood moon," will be visible from parts of the UK on Sunday evening, weather permitting. This phenomenon, where the moon turns deep red, occurs when the Earth passes between the sun and the moon. This will be the first such event visible from the UK since 2022, expected to start around 7:30 pm.

title: Thunder Rookie Sorber Out for Season with ACL Tear
snippets: Thunder rookie big man Thomas Sorber tore the ACL in his right knee and will miss the 2025-26 season, the team announced.
Sorber is the latest in a string of bad luck for Thunder draft picks in their rookie years
titles: OKC rookie Sorber out for season with torn ACL

summary: Thomas Sorber, a rookie for the Oklahoma City Thunder, has torn the ACL in his right knee and will miss the entire 2025-26 NBA season, the team confirmed. This marks the second year in a row that a Thunder first-round draft pick has been sidelined for an entire season due to an ACL injury.

title: New Method Converts PET Waste into CO2-Capturing Material
snippets: A team of chemists has discovered how to transform PET plastic waste into BAETA, a material that captures CO2 with remarkable efficiency. Instead of ending up as microplastics in the environment, discarded bottles and textiles could become tools to combat climate change. The method is energy-friendl

Chemists at the University of Copenhagen have developed a method to convert plastic waste into a climate solution for efficient and sustainable CO2 capture. This is killing two birds with one stone as they address two of the world's biggest challenges: plastic pollution and the climate crisis.
titles: Scientists made plastic that eats carbon
Scientists transform plastic waste into efficient CO‚ÇÇ capture materials
summary: Chemists at the University of Copenhagen have developed a method to convert PET plastic waste into BAETA, a material that efficiently captures CO2, addressing plastic pollution and climate change simultaneously. This innovative, energy-friendly process offers a dual solution to major environmental challenges.

titles: US Navy SEALs killed North Korean civilians during botched mission: Report

title: South Korea Protests ICE Raid at Hyundai Plant, 475 Arrested
snippets: "The business activities of our investors and the rights of our nationals must not be unjustly infringed," a foreign ministry spokesman said after about 300 South Koreans were detained.

Most of the 475 people arrested in a raid on a Hyundai-LG battery factory under construction in the state of Georgia were from South Korea. Relations between Washington and Seoul have become strained of late.
titles: Hundreds of South Koreans are among 475 detained in a Georgia immigration raid
US: South Koreans detained in ICE raid on Hyundai plant
summary: In a recent ICE raid at a Georgia-based Hyundai plant, approximately 475 individuals were arrested, with a significant number being South Korean nationals. This action prompted South Korea to demand protection for its nationals and investors, labeling the raid as an unjust infringement of rights. The foreign ministry emphasized the importance of not unjustly infringing on the business activities and rights of their nationals.
